subject: Re: [cc-community] Business
body:
Hey Adisa,
 
You could try ccMixter but you may 
not get such a great response.  ccMixter isn't really about collaboration 
in that sense, though some of the community (myself included) are trying to 
campaign for a slight shift away from total competition focus.
 
Kompoz.com is also worth looking at, 
it's a new contender and they're interested in new members with cool 
ideas.  They have slightly greater license flexibility too, because they 
have the SA kinds of licenses.
 
There's nothing wrong with making 
money from your hard work, but it's also fun to give things away or at least 
allow folks to share your stuff without fear of being sued! 
 
:)
 
Good luck!
 
Kev
 
----- Original Message ----- 
From: adisa 
mckenzie 
To: creative commons 
Sent: Monday, April 30, 2007 11:57 PM
Subject: [cc-community] Business

I was thinking of posting songs (music and vocals) on ccmixter or a similar 
site and leaving space for people to add their own verses.  then 
selecting versions i like and asking if the artist would like enter into an 
agreement to sell the songs through cd baby, itunes, record stores, etc. we 
would then share the profits of the sales.i have read many forums and 
discussions in the past and i can not tell if this in alignment with the 
creative commons spirit. also, what version(s) of the creative commons would i 
apply?
